item.title: The Blueprint For AI Agents That Work (ft Diamond Bishop)
item.description:
Master the art of building AI agents and powerful AI teammates with Diamond Bishop, Director of Engineering and AI at Datadog. In this deep dive, we explore crucial strategies for creating self-improving agent systems, from establishing robust evaluations (evals) and observability to designing effective human-in-the-loop escape hatches. Learn the secrets to building user trust, deciding between prompt engineering and fine-tuning, and managing data sets for peak performance. Diamond shares his expert insights on architecting agents, using LLM as a judge for quality control, and the future of ambient AI in DevSecOps. If you're looking to build your own AI assistant, this episode provides the essential principles and practical advice you need to get started and create systems that learn and improve over time.


Guest: Diamond Bishop, Director of Engineering and AI at Datadog

Learn more about Bits AI SRE: https://www.datadoghq.com/blog/bits-ai-sre/

Datadog MCP Server for Agents: https://www.datadoghq.com/blog/datadog-remote-mcp-server/


Sign up for A.I. coaching for professionals at: https://www.anetic.co


Get FREE AI tools

Connect with us

https://x.com/ToolUseAI

https://x.com/MikeBirdTech

https://x.com/diamondbishop

item.title: The Right Way to Do AI Evals (ft Freddie Vargus)
item.description:
Are your AI agents unreliable? In this guide, we reveal a professional system for AI evals to help you build and ship better AI products, faster. Learn how to systematically test LLM performance, evaluate complex tool use, and improve multi-turn conversations. We break down the exact process for building a high-quality eval dataset, using milestones and minefields to track agent behaviour, and how to properly use an LLM as a judge without compromising quality. Stop guessing and start making real, measurable improvements to your AI today.

item.title: Use AI to Catch Your Bad Leadership Habits (ft Ian Pilon)
item.description:
Sign up for A.I. coaching for professionals at: https://www.anetic.co


Unlock the secrets of better communication with AI! In this episode, we explore how to use AI for leadership development, enhance your communication skills, and improve user experience (UX) with AI tools. Innovator and author Ian Pilon (Cultivating Clarity) joins us to discuss the future of human-computer interaction beyond the simple chatbot. Learn how to leverage AI as a sparring partner, analyze your subconscious behaviors to become a more effective leader, and use contextual intelligence to get more from your prompts. We cover everything from building AI agents and organizing communities to the practical strategies for using large language models (LLMs) to overcome the blank page problem and prepare for difficult conversations.


Learn more about Ian Pilon:

https://www.linkedin.com/in/ianpilon/

item.title: Your Everyday Data Holds Life Changing Secrets (ft Michael Tiffany)
item.description:
Sign up for A.I. coaching for professionals at: https://www.anetic.co


Unlock the power of your personal data with AI! This episode explores how AI can become your guardian angel for wellbeing, helping anticipate your needs by understanding your unique data. Michael Tiffany, CEO of Fulcra, joins us to discuss building trustworthy AI systems for sensitive human information, the importance of data sovereignty, and how platforms like Fulcra are de-siloing data from wearables like Apple Watch and Oura Ring. Discover insights on sleep optimization, unique data correlations, the future of agentic AI, and the critical need for individual control over personal data in an AI-driven world. We delve into data privacy, the potential of personalized recommendation algorithms, and how to ensure AI empowers rather than creates dependency.


Learn more about Fulcra:

https://www.fulcradynamics.com/

https://discord.gg/pwvzFDTr87


Join the world's largest privacy-preserving sleep study: https://www.fulcradynamics.com/studies/how-the-world-sleeps

item.title: The Best Developer Experience For Building A.I. Agents (ft Ahmad Awais)
item.description:
Unlock the secrets to world-class developer experience for AI agents! Discover how to build powerful, reliable AI agents with Ahmad Awais, founder and CEO of Lang Base, a serverless platform revolutionizing AI development. We dive deep into overcoming complex tooling and steep learning curves, exploring AI primitives, and the groundbreaking AI coding agent, Chai, which builds other AI agents for you. Learn about agentic RAG, memory agents, scaling agent workflows, and the future of AI agent creation. Ahmad shares his journey from open-source contributor to AI innovator, and how Lang Base and Chai are tearing down barriers to innovation in the AI space. If you're building, designing, or dreaming of the next generation of AI, this episode is essential viewing.


Lang Base: https://langbase.com/

Chai: https://chai.new/

item.description:
Unlock the power of AI development and learn to build your own custom AI tools! In this episode, we dive deep into AI coding strategies with AI engineer Manuel Odendahl. Discover practical approaches to identify opportunities, leverage existing services like Cursor, Gemini, and Sonnet, and craft bespoke software solutions tailored precisely to your unique challenges. Whether you're a developer aiming to expand your toolkit or someone with a problem needing a fix, we teach the mindset and methods to build AI-powered tools yourself, solving those nagging day-to-day problems. item.title: Why AI Agents Fail In Production And How To Fix It (ft Josh Purtell)
item.description:
Unlock the reality of AI agents in production! While the AI agent gold rush is on, many businesses and developers struggle to move beyond expectation. This episode dives deep into the three fundamental challenges of AI agents: observability, reliability, and performance. Discover actionable strategies to overcome these hurdles and deploy your AI agent to production with confidence. Learn how to effectively communicate your needs to your AI, avoid common pitfalls like context window overload, and implement effective AI agent evals and debugging processes. We explore building high-value vs. low-value agents, structuring prompts for clarity, and the future of interacting with these powerful AI tools. If you're building or considering AI agents, this conversation is packed with insights on making them truly work.


Learn more about Synth: https://www.usesynth.ai/


Sign up for A.I. coaching for professionals at: https://www.anetic.co

item.title: How The Best Product Managers Use AI (ft Elina Lesyk)
item.description:
Is traditional AI Product Management becoming obsolete? Elina Lesyk, AI consultant and host of the AI Ketchup podcast, joins Tool Use to explore how AI is fundamentally reshaping the product management workflow. We dive into the necessary technical skills for AI PMs, whether AI prototyping tools like Bolt and V0 are replacing classic methods, essential AI UX design principles, and the core skills defining effective AI product leaders. Discover common AI implementation pitfalls, strategies for gathering user feedback for AI products, and how to identify promising AI use cases without forcing the tech. Essential insights for product managers, builders, and anyone navigating the AI shift in building products.


Connect with Elina Lesyk:

AI Ketchup Podcast: https://pod.elinalesyk.com

item.title: Google Scientist's Insights on AI Education & Tools (ft Dr Stefania Druga)
item.description:
Master AI education and boost AI literacy with insights from Dr. Stefania Druga, Google Gemini research scientist and creator of Cognimates. Explore how to use AI to learn about AI, effective strategies for teaching AI concepts to kids and adults, and the crucial role of hands-on tinkering. We discuss overcoming learning barriers, designing AI tools that augment creativity without stifling imagination (like smart toys vs. real-world learning), the nuances of anthropomorphizing AI, and the future of multimodal AI applications in education and beyond. item.title: The Henry Ford Approach To Building Modern AI (ft Minki Jung)
item.description:
Flow engineering, AI workflows, and intelligent automation strategies for developers and AI builders. In this episode of Tool Use, we explore how orchestrating multiple AI steps transforms complex systems beyond simple prompt engineering.


Learn why most AI builders focus too much on crafting perfect prompts when real-world applications demand intelligent workflows. Discover Minki Jung's practical advice on decomposing tasks, designing ergonomic prompts, and building AI systems that actually work.


Key topics covered:


- How to think about AI workflows like Henry Ford's assembly line

- The difference between prompt engineering and flow engineering

- Practical techniques for decomposing complex AI tasks

- When to use LLMs vs. traditional programming in your workflow

- How to create memory and judgment within AI systems

- Tips for testing and evaluating AI workflows


Whether you're building AI content systems, tools, assistants, or decision engines, this episode will completely change how you approach AI architecture.

item.title: Why AI Agents Keep Failing at Simple Tasks (ft Dexter Horthy)
item.description:
This week, we explore why keeping humans in the loop is crucial for AI agent success. Discover how "outer loop agents" can transform unreliable 80% accuracy into enterprise-grade solutions through strategic human checkpoints.


Our guest, Dexter Horthy explains how human-in-the-loop systems enable AI to handle high-stakes tasks like infrastructure management, supply chain operations, and critical business decisions that would otherwise be too risky. Learn about the practical frameworks for implementing human oversight that major companies are already using to deploy AI safely and effectively.


If you're building AI agents or automations and struggling with reliability issues, this episode reveals the missing piece in your system design. Find out why the future of AI isn't about complete autonomy, but intelligent collaboration between humans and machines.


Check out HumanLayer:

https://www.humanlayer.dev/

https://github.com/humanlayer/12-factor-agents

item.title: Will AI Agents Be Your Automation Breakthrough? (ft NLW)
item.description:
This week we're joined by Nathaniel Whittlemore (NLW), founder and CEO of Superintelligent and host of the AI Daily Brief podcast, for an in-depth discussion on the current state of AI agents. We explore the evolving definition of AI agents, why getting caught up in technical definitions may be missing the point, and examine real-world use cases and limitations of AI agents in business today. NLW shares insights on why most companies are still best suited for single-purpose, specific agents rather than complex multi-agent systems, and discusses the challenges of AI adoption, from data readiness to employee resistance.


The conversation explores how companies are shifting from buying to building their own AI solutions, the cultural and leadership challenges of implementing AI agents, and predictions for AI agent development in 2025 and beyond. NLW also provides practical advice for staying up-to-date in the rapidly evolving AI landscape.


Check out Superintelligent

https://besuper.ai/

item.title: Building AI's Future: From Open Data to Robots (ft. Victor Miller)
item.description: In this episode, we dive deep into the world of open source AI with Victor Miller from LLM360. Learn why open source data is crucial for training better AI models (and how it's shaping the future of robotics). Victor shares insights on TXT360 (a 15 trillion token dataset) and explains why data quality matters more than ever in AI development.Key topics covered:- Why open source matters in AI development- The relationship between data quality and model performance- The future of robotics as an AI application layer- How to get started building with open source AI- Practical advice for newcomers to AI developmentVictor also discusses recent developments in open source models, including DeepSeek, Sky T1, and S1, and shares his perspective on the future of AI applications in robotics and beyond.Get FREE AI tools pip install tool-use-ai Connect with us https://x.com/ToolUseAI https://x.com/MikeBirdTech https://x.com/FieroTy02:22 - What makes a good LLM training dataset 06:00 - The importance of open source in AI development 14:12 - MetaGene model for virus detection and public health 24:24 - Challenges and future of home roboticsTool Use is a weekly conversation about helpful AI tools you can use today, brought to you by Anetic.

item.title: We Built an AI Tool That Saves Us $360/yr
item.description: In this episode, we return to our demo roots with something special - an open source meeting transcriber and audio processor that runs 100% locally. We're tired of paying monthly subscriptions for basic tools, so we built WhisperBox. Please consider supporting the channel and purchasing the GUI version of Whisperbox https://tooluse.gumroad.com/l/whisperbox Get Whisperbox for free Code: https://github.com/ToolUse/whisperbox Install: pip install whisperbox Get FREE AI tools pip install tool-use-ai Connect with us https://x.com/ToolUseAI https://x.com/MikeBirdTech https://x.com/FieroTy 01:15 - Anetic announcement 04:44 - Whisperbox 08:52 - Demos 23:22 - AI News Discussion

item.title: Learn AI Engineering 10x Faster (ft. Hai Nghiem)
item.description: AI education is changing forever. Hai Nghiem shows us Cats with Bats, an innovative platform that makes learning AI engineering faster and more intuitive. item.title: 10 AI Tools That Actually Deliver Results (ft. Ray Fernando)
item.description:
Join us for an in-depth conversation with Ray Fernando, a former Apple engineer turned live streamer, as we explore the world of AI-powered tools and transcription. From his journey into AI to his experiences with various models and tools, Ray shares his insights on building app experiences, overcoming difficulties, and the importance of user experience. Ty and Mike give demos for:

  • A productivity AI coach that uses a webcam to track posture and focus
  • A tool called Fuzzy Puffin that uses natural language to interact with a pip package

item.title: Build Your AI Marketing Machine
item.description:
In this episode, Mike Bird and Ty Fiero explore the exciting possibilities of AI in marketing, discussing the potential benefits and challenges of using artificial intelligence to revolutionize the field. They demonstrate how to use Obsidian to generate viral tweets and create a marketing agency using the OpenAI Swarm framework. In this episode, we're joined by Murat Koylan, a prompt engineer and AI marketer who shares his expertise. Murat emphasizes the importance of understanding the underlying mechanics of language models and highlights the need for human evaluation in AI-generated content. Links:

LinkedIn:

https://linkedin.com/in/muratcan-koylan

The content reverse engineering prompt:

https://github.com/muratcankoylan/prompts/blob/main/ContentAnalyzer

https://storm.genie.stanford.edu/

item.title: How do AI Engineers Use AI Tools?
item.description:
Start building your own AI tools today! Join us as we take a step back and explore the world of building AI tools. This week, we're joined by Jason Kneen, an app engineer turned AI engineer, who shares his expertise and insights. Subscribe to Jason's Twitter: https://x.com/jasonkneen Episode Highlights:

  • Ty demonstrates the power of Cursor IDE and Claude, with a focus on Claude projects and Cursor rules
  • Mike showcases his Alacritty terminal setup, including functions, aliases, Alacritty hints, and using Automator to turn scripts into programs
  • Jason walks us through using Krea for AI art generation

Stay tuned for our extended conversation episode where we'll dive into deeper discussions on AI tool development! Code: https://github.com/MikeBirdTech/dotfileshttps://github.com/tyfiero Connect with us: https://x.com/ToolUseAIhttps://x.com/FieroTyhttps://x.com/MikeBirdTechhttps://x.com/jasonkneen

Stay tuned for our extended conversation episode where we'll dive into deeper discussions on AI tool development! Code: https://github.com/MikeBirdTech/dotfileshttps://github.com/tyfiero Connect with us: https://x.com/ToolUseAIhttps://x.com/FieroTyhttps://x.com/MikeBirdTechhttps://x.com/jasonkneen

item.title: The Future of Voice Agents with Killian Lucas
item.description: Join us for this week's episode of Tool Use as we dive into the exciting world of voice intelligence. We're joined by special guest Killian Lucas, creator of Open Interpreter, as we explore the latest developments in AI tools. We discuss the latest advancements in voice intelligence, including voice-controlled agents and speech-to-speech systems. Killian shares his personal story of getting into the AI space and building Open Interpreter, an open-source project that allows users to run code on their computers using natural language. He also shows a demo of making a voice assistant patiently wait for its turn to talk. Shallowgram - open source and local version of Deepgram 01 Voices - give your 01 a custom voice and persona from a single prompt Check out Open Interpreter https://openinterpreter.com Code: Shallowgram: https://github.com/MikeBirdTech/ai-to... 01 Voices: https://github.com/tyfiero/tool-use Connect with us: https://x.com/ToolUseAI https://x.com/MikeBirdTech https://x.com/FieroTy https://x.com/hellokillian

item.title: Activity Tracker and Calendar Automator
item.description: Time is our most precious resource, let's use AI to optimize it! In this episode of Tool Use, Mike Bird and Ty Fiero discuss the importance of time management and explore AI-powered tools that can help optimize productivity. They share their personal experiences with using AI tools to manage their time and highlight the benefits of such tools. Watch as Mike demonstrates an activity tracker that uses Whisper to recognize spoken activities and categorize them using an LLM. The tracker can also provide statistics on time spent on different activities and offer insights on how to optimize time management. Ty introduces Calvin, a CLI app that integrates with Google Calendar and can create, edit, and delete events. Calvin uses cloud-based apps behind the scenes and can be used to automate workflows. Joining the conversation is Orlando, co-founder of Toolhouse, who discusses his company's mission to give superpowers to LLMs. He demonstrates a tool that uses Toolhouse to extract information from a database using natural language queries. The conversation turns to the future of AI, including the potential for mixture of experts models and the importance of decentralization. Check out Toolhouse: https://toolhouse.ai/ Code: Activity Tracker: https://github.com/MikeBirdTech/ai-to... Calendar Automator: https://github.com/tyfiero/tool-use Read about OLMOE: https://huggingface.co/allenai/OLMoE-... Connect with us: https://x.com/ToolUseAIhttps://x.com/MikeBirdTechhttps://x.com/FieroTyhttps://x.com/sunglassesface

item.title: Video to Content Pipeline and YouTube Playlist Summarization
item.description: Ty and Mike show you how to extract data from videos to leverage in amazing ways. Have AI get information from videos to improve your life. Have a YouTube playlist that's grown so big that you'll never get to watch all the videos? Ty shows you how you can turn those videos into consumable summaries. Did you make a video and want to generate content from it? Mike shows you how you can use AI to turn a video into many different pieces of content. Learn about the amazing work done by the Human Feedback Foundation. Learn about how consumers are tired of hearing about AI in your marketing material. Code: https://github.com/MikeBirdTech/ai-to...https://github.com/tyfiero/tool-use Be sure to subscribe and keep up on X: https://x.com/tooluseai Connect with Ty and Mike on X: https://x.com/FieroTyhttps://x.com/MikeBirdTech
